column4: you can download the source of any package from its website or from the repos

sudo apt-get install nautilus will upgrade it (and only nautilus) if there is a newer version on the repos
you cant install ubuntu on ntfs, you can use wubi which will install to a file on an ntfs partition
i plan to install it through booting from the CD, and install it on my storage hard drive
you'd have to format the partition to ntfs (and lose the data on it)
is there another way to format, just the size of the partition to NTFS? i was just wondering
you can resize partitions
i mean just to format the xubuntu partition, not the whole hard disk
sure, you will format the partition you want
no i mean just to delete the total size on which i install xubuntu in
you can delete the Xubuntu partitions then rerun the installer. It will see the free space and you can reset up the install
ah, if i install xubuntu on an NTFS file system, and then set the size for ubuntu to be install in, the installer will create a new partition for xubuntu?
ah, if i install xubuntu on an NTFS file system, and then set the size for xubuntu to be install in, the installer will create a new partition for xubuntu?
if i install xubuntu on an NTFS file system, and then set the size for xubuntu to be install in, the installer will create a new partition for xubuntu?
you dont install xubuntu on an ntfs partition, you will need to resize the ntfs so you have unpartitioned space which the installer can then use
ah ok thanks
you can make life easier by making the ntfs not take up 100% of the space and you wont have to resize
this involves planning the partitioning when you install the windows system and using custom sizing rather than using the windows default 100% size

does sudo transcend the pipe?
i didn't get what you said
could cover all by running: sudo -i    then run your command
for example:  cat "text" > /usr/bin/file   will NOT work, sudo does not transcend the > character, the correct way is:  cat "text" | sudo tess /usr/bin/file
this puts sudo on the left side of the operator, do you know if pipes need similar treatment??
it worked it deleted dockbarx

sure, usb_modeswitch makes them stop being USB storage and become modems
log off, then select the session when you log in, it will be remembered for next time

how do i make a openbox session?
install openbox, log off and select openbox at the login, or you can replace the default xfce WM with openbox by pressing ALT+F2 and running: openbox --replace
